content.title: Apple's Q1 earnings beat: Key takeaways
content.description:
Apple (AAPL) reported fiscal first quarter results that handily topped Wall Street estimates on both the top and bottom lines. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley and Freedom Capital Markets managing director Paul Meeks share their key takeaways from the report and conference call.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
content.summary: Apple (AAPL) reported fiscal first quarter results that handily topped Wall Street estimates on both the top and bottom lines. Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley and Freedom Capital Markets managing director Paul Meeks share their key takeaways from the report and conference call.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Apple just reported its best-ever quarter for iPhone sales
Apple CEO Tim Cook talks memory shortages, other supply constraints
AI is an 'existential threat' for Apple, analyst says
content.description:
Apple (AAPL) reported fiscal first quarter adjusted earnings of $2.84 per share compared to the $2.68 estimate. Revenue was $143.76 billion versus a $138.40 billion expectation.

Seaport Research Partners senior analyst Jay Goldberg joins Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton to discuss the earnings print and the company's ongoing artificial intelligence (AI) trajectory.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.
content.summary: Apple (AAPL) reported fiscal first quarter adjusted earnings of $2.84 per share compared to the $2.68 estimate. Revenue was $143.76 billion versus a $138.40 billion expectation.Seaport Research Partners senior analyst Jay Goldberg joins Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton to discuss the earnings print and the company's ongoing artificial intelligence (AI) trajectory.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

content.title: Apple earnings top estimates on top & bottom lines
Stock market today: S&P 500, Nasdaq fall as Microsoft leads tech lower with Apple earnings on deck
Small caps are getting a leg up from lower rates, Big Beautiful Bill
content.description:
Earnings season kicks off for the Magnificent Seven this week, with Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), and Tesla (TSLA) reporting quarterly results yesterday and Apple (AAPL) releasing after Thursday's market close.

Madison Investments chief investment strategist Patrick Ryan is taking a look at the rest of the S&P 500 (^GSPC) — or the S&P 493 — and the opportunities for small-cap stocks  (^RUT) amid lower interest rates and President Trump's Big, Beautiful Bill legislation.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

content.title: Apple acquires Q.ai for a reported $2 billion
content.summary: Apple has acquired Israel-based startup Q.ai, a move that could provide a much-needed boost to the tech giant's capabilities in artificial intelligence.

content.title: Will gold prices hit $6,000 this year? How readers voted
content.summary: Further geopolitical uncertainty has buoyed demand for gold as a so-called safe-haven asset, pushing prices past the $5,000 mark.

content.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Falls On Surprise Inflation Data, Warsh Nomination; Tesla Rallies (Live Coverage)
content.summary: Stock Market Today: The Dow Jones index dropped Friday on surprise inflation data and the Warsh nomination. Tesla rallied on SpaceX news.

content.title: AI Monetization Is the Story for Apple in 2026: Dan Ives
content.description: Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities global head of tech research, reacts to Apple's earnings report and says AI will be the top story for the company in 2026. Speaking on "Bloomberg Surveillance," Ives also says Apple will probably have to raise iPhone prices.
